chapter.title: cadcUtil Tests
chapter.para: This chapter explains how to use cadc utilities tests just to check if basic utilities are well working.

section.title: ant test usage
section.para:
To run ant test it is needed a proxy file in ${CADC_PREFIX}/etc/proxy.pem. This proxy file can be created starting from the user identity certificate (released by a Certification Authority) in .pem format or staring from user_cert.pem and user_key.pem files joined in one unique file doing:
cat mykey.pem mycert.pem >> mycert_and_key.pem
At this point, the proxy.pem file can be generated issuing:
${CADC_PREFIX}/cadcUtil/scripts/createProxyCert /root/certs/mycert_and_key.pem <days of validity number> ${CADC_PREFIX}/etc
Now ant tests can be run:
cd ${CADC_PREFIX}/cadcUtil ant test
